api_key.description: The Spectro Cloud API key. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_APIKEY` environment variable.

host.description: The Spectro Cloud API host url. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_HOST` environment variable. Defaults to https://api.spectrocloud.com

ignore_insecure_tls_error.description: Ignore insecure TLS errors for Spectro Cloud API endpoints. Defaults to false.

password.description: The Spectro Cloud user password. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_PASSWORD` environment variable.

retry_attempts.description: Number of retry attempts. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_RETRY_ATTEMPTS` environment variable. Defaults to 10.

trace.description: Enable HTTP request tracing. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_TRACE` environment variable. To enable Terraform debug logging, set `TF_LOG=DEBUG`. Visit the Terraform documentation to learn more about Terraform [debugging](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/plugin/log/managing).

username.description: The Spectro Cloud username. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_USERNAME` environment variable.

id.description: The ID of the cluster profile.

name.description: The name of the pack. The name must be unique within the cluster profile.

registry_uid.description: The registry UID of the pack. The registry UID is the unique identifier of the registry.

tag.description: The tag of the pack. The tag is the version of the pack.

type.description: The type of the pack. The default value is `spectro`.

values.description: The values of the pack. The values are the configuration values of the pack. The values are specified in YAML format.

content.description: The content of the manifest. The content is the YAML content of the manifest.

name.description: The name of the manifest. The name must be unique within the pack.

cloud.description: The cloud provider the profile is eligible for. Default value is `all`.

context.description: Context of the profile. Allowed values are `project`, `cluster`, or `namespace`. Default value is `project`.

name.description: Name of the application profile

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the application profile. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

version.description: Version of the profile. Default value is 1.0.0.

install_order.description: The installation priority order of the app profile. The order of priority goes from lowest number to highest number. For example, a value of `-3` would be installed before an app profile with a higher number value. No upper and lower limits exist, and you may specify positive and negative integers. The default value is `0`.

name.description: The name of the specified pack.

properties.description: The various properties required by different database tiers eg: `databaseName` and `databaseVolumeSize` size for Redis etc.

registry_uid.description: The unique id of the registry to be used for the pack.

source_app_tier.description: The unique id of the pack to be used as the source for the pack.

tag.description: The identifier or version to label the pack.

type.description: The type of Pack. Allowed values are `container`, `helm`, `manifest`, or `operator-instance`.

uid.description: The unique id of the pack. This is a computed field and is not required to be set.

values.description: The values to be used for the pack. This is a stringified JSON object.

name.description: The name of the manifest.

block.description: The manifest of the pack.
A list of packs to be applied to the application profile.

Provisions an Application Profile. App Profiles are templates created with preconfigured services. You can create as many profiles as required, with multiple tiers serving different functionalities per use case.

context.description: Context of the cloud account. This can be either project or tenant. If not specified, the default value is project.

name.description: Name of the cloud account. This name is used to identify the cloud account in the Spectro Cloud UI.

private_cloud_gateway_id.description: ID of the private cloud gateway. This is the ID of the private cloud gateway that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

vsphere_ignore_insecure_error.description: Ignore insecure error. This is a boolean value that indicates whether to ignore the insecure error or not. If not specified, the default value is false.

vsphere_password.description: Password of the vSphere cloud. This is the password of the vSphere cloud that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

vsphere_username.description: Username of the vSphere cloud. This is the username of the vSphere cloud that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

vsphere_vcenter.description: vCenter server address. This is the address of the vCenter server that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

block.description: A resource to manage a vSphere cloud account in Pallette.

cloud_config_id.description: ID of the cloud config used for the cluster. This cloud config must be of type `azure`.

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`.

os_patch_after.description: The date and time after which to patch the cluster. Prefix the time value with the respective RFC. Ex: `RFC3339: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00`

os_patch_on_boot.description: Whether to apply OS patch on boot. Default is `false`.

os_patch_schedule.description: The cron schedule for OS patching. This must be in the form of cron syntax. Ex: `0 0 * * *`.

skip_completion.description: If `true`, the cluster will be created asynchronously. Default value is `false`.

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the cluster. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

role.description: The role of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

type.description: The type of the RBAC binding. Can be one of the following values: `RoleBinding`, or `ClusterRoleBinding`.

name.description: The name of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'User' or 'Group'.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'ServiceAccount'.

type.description: The type of the subject. Can be one of the following values: `User`, `Group`, or `ServiceAccount`.

external_traffic_policy.description: The external traffic policy for the cluster.

host_endpoint_type.description: The type of endpoint for the cluster. Can be either 'Ingress' or 'LoadBalancer'. The default is 'Ingress'.

ingress_host.description: The host for the Ingress endpoint. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'Ingress'.

load_balancer_source_ranges.description: The source ranges for the load balancer. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'LoadBalancer'.

update_strategy.description: Update strategy for the machine pool. Valid values are `RollingUpdateScaleOut` and `RollingUpdateScaleIn`.

The cloud-init user data to be used for the virtual machine. Default value is `#cloud-config
ssh_pwauth: True
chpasswd: { expire: False }
password: spectro
disable_root: false
`.
